headline.main: REPLY TO THE AXIS; President at Dayton Is Blunt in His Talk on Dictator Nations HEMISPHERE UNITY CITED Appeasement Rejected, While No Line-Up in Europe or Asia Will Stop Our Aid to Britain

byline.original: By CHARLES HURD Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Oct. 13--It has been learned from an unimpeachable diplomatic source here tonight that Brazil and Chile have agreed to lease naval and air bases to the United States.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Oct. 13--It has been learned from an unimpeachable diplomatic source here tonight that Brazil and Chile have agreed to lease naval and air bases to the United States.
docs.abstract: diplomatic source in Argentina repts Brazil and Chile agreeing to lease naval and air bases to U S; map; cooperation presumed; Uruguay believed ready to withdraw objections to leasing bases to U S; U S officials decline to comment

headline.main: U.S. LEASING BASES IN BRAZIL AND CHILE; AMERICAN OIL IS MOVED TO SINGAPORE; ROME REPORTS BRITISH CRUISER SUNK; COASTS DEFENDED Para and Valparaiso Are Suggested as Likely Points for Building MORE DEALS WILL FOLLOW Uruguay Now Believed to Have Withdrawn Objection to Fortification at Plate

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITE Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: ROME, Oct. 13--Italy, claiming another naval success over Britain, reported today that a 7,000-ton British cruiser of the Neptune class had been sunk and a heavy cruiser and an aircraft carrier "heavily damaged" in a battle near Malta. Italian...
docs.lead_paragraph: ROME, Oct. 13--Italy, claiming another naval success over Britain, reported today that a 7,000-ton British cruiser of the Neptune class had been sunk and a heavy cruiser and an aircraft carrier "heavily damaged" in a battle near Malta. Italian losses, a communique says, were one 1,400-ton destroyer and two 600-ton torpedo boats.
docs.abstract: Itals claim Brit cruiser sunk and cruiser and aircraft carrier damaged in battle off Malta; admit 1 destroyer and 2 torpedo boats lost; rept Brit and Ital forces clashed near Sidi Barrani, and planes bombed Maaten Bagush and El Daba; admit RAF bombed Libyan Eritrean and Ethiopian points; London officials scout Ital naval victory claims

headline.main: BATTLE OFF SICILY; Italians Lose Destroyer and 2 Torpedo Boats, but Claim Victory SAY FLIERS HIT A CARRIER Another British Cruiser Held Damaged--Graziani Forces Move East in Egypt

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: If the report from our correspondent at Buenos Aires is later confirmed by official announcement, the United States will have taken a further important step in its own defenses and in the defense of the Western Hemisphere.
docs.lead_paragraph: If the report from our correspondent at Buenos Aires is later confirmed by official announcement, the United States will have taken a further important step in its own defenses and in the defense of the Western Hemisphere.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14--The United States and Canada and the British Government are planning to begin the construction of Atlantic air and naval bases, without awaiting final signature of the last details of their contracts for this undertaking,...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14--The United States and Canada and the British Government are planning to begin the construction of Atlantic air and naval bases, without awaiting final signature of the last details of their contracts for this undertaking, Secretary of State Cordell Hull declared at his press conference today.
